metadata.Title: CVE-2020-16119 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - high
metadata.Description:
Use-after-free vulnerability in the Linux kernel exploitable by a localattacker due to reuse of a DCCP socket with an attached dccps_hc_tx_ccidobject as a listener after being released. Fixed in Ubuntu Linux kernel5.4.0-51.56, 5.3.0-68.63, 4.15.0-121.123, 4.4.0-193.224, 3.13.0.182.191 and3.2.0-149.196.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-16119` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.4.0-51-generic - 5.4.0-51.56
linux-image-5.4.0-51-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-51.56
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-51-generic - 5.4.0-51.56
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-51-lowlatency - 5.4.0-51.56
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1026-kvm - 5.4.0-1026.27
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-1028-aws - 5.4.0-1028.29
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1031-azure - 5.4.0-1031.32
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1028-gcp - 5.4.0-1028.29
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1028-oracle - 5.4.0-1028.29
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.6.0-1031-oem - 5.6.0-1031.32
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-1021-raspi - 5.4.0-1021.24
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-51.56').
linux-kvm package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-1026.27').
linux-aws package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-1028.29').
linux-azure package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-1031.32').
linux-gcp package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-1028.29').
linux-oracle package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-1028.29').
linux-oem-5.6 package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.6.0-1031.32').
linux-raspi package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-1021.24').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of life, was needs-triage').
